results.title: Internal organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Illustrates the fundamental purposes of business organization and basic organizational procedures, such as delegation of authority, division of labour and assignment of responsibility. Shows the types of organization that can be adapted to the needs of any enterprise.

results.title: Intern: a long year
results.creator_credit: John Barnes, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Michael Livesey and Robert Johnson
results.brief_description: The year a doctor spends as an intern may seem routine to someone not in the medical profession. But for an intern it is a kaliedoscopic experience: the cases once studied only in textbooks become living patients. It is a difficult year for most interns, including Dr Karen Mack, the subject of this film.

results.title: Intermezzo
results.creator_credit: David O. Selznick, David O Selznick Productions and Gregory Ratoff
results.brief_description: A tragic but moving love story starring Ingrid Bergmann and Leslie Howard. The great concert violonist Holger Brandt is attracted to Anita Hoffman although he is happily married. He soon finds his love for Anita overwhelming and leaves his wife to tour Europe with her. But he cannot leave his past and his family ties behind and Anita sensing his dilemma, leaves him although it breaks her heart. Eventually Holgar and his wife are reunited as they share a personal tragedy. Sentimental, ‘Intermezzo’ is a great romantic classic.

results.title: Intermezzo
results.creator_credit: John Cox, Glyndebourne, BBC-TV and David Buckan
results.brief_description: Intermezzo by Richard Strauss is an autobiographical opera based on the real life relationship between Richard Strauss and his wife Pauline using the characters Robert and Christine Storch. Set in the 1920s, the central plot involves an innocent flirtation by the lonely and bored Christine (Felicity Lott) with the charming, but penniless, Baron Lummer (Ian Caley) whilst her composer husband Robert (John Pringle) is away on an official visit to Vienna. However life becomes complicated when an unexpected letter is delivered to Christine, the contents of which lead her to suspect her husband of having an illicit affair. This is an opera of comedy and wit with a blend of talking and singing, told in 14 scenes with symphonic interludes. Costume and set designs are lavish and stylish and very art nouveau authentically recreating the era and atmosphere of the times. Features the London Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Gustav Kuhn and supporting cast including Elizabeth Gale in the role of Anna, the chambermaid.

results.title: Intermediate tumbling
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tumbling”.
This film demonstrates the kip, rolling kip, headspring, handspring, thigh stand, shoulder mount, shoulder dive, lift and toss, back to back pullover, back over feet, front over neck, foot to pelvis somersault, and hand-spring over back.

results.title: Interlude in the marshland = Uppehall i myrlandet
results.brief_description: Follows a restless train brakeman, played by Max Von Sydow, as he decides to abandon his train in a marshland and take a brief vacation from work. (Awards: A Blue Ribbon winner in the 1973 American Film Festival) Swedish dialogue, English subtitles.

results.title: Interlude by candlelight
results.creator_credit: Marlina Van der Linden and Charles Van der Linden
results.brief_description: The late puppeteer Harry van Tussenbroek used to collect shells, birds’ skulls and pieces of driftwood on the beach, from which he made quaint dolls and puppets. In this film he is seen in his home with his “children”, dreaming by the fire. The dream suddenly takes on a strange twist where the dolls come to life, and in their strange dream-world they play the eternal game of good and evil, of light and darkness. Narrated by Jill Melford. This film is not recommended for showing to young children.

results.title: Interior lighting: bringing rooms to life
results.brief_description: See how lighting is a critical part of successful design. Poorly planned or inadequate lighting results in rooms not reaching their full potential both in appearance and comfort. This video illustrates the basics of lighting residential interiors and shows how you can improve the lighting in your own home. Learn how light shapes physical space and human emotion, how bounced light changes the perception of colors, how and when to diffuse light, how the simple choice of a light bulb changes the feeling of a room, how the modern lamp shade is a surprisingly sophisticated tool of light control and much much more.

results.title: Intergalactic zoo
results.brief_description: An album of animated characters from a zoo located on Mars. All the characters are created from a string of beads with various distinguishing features added, using normal animation techniques. The characters are creations of a highly imaginative mind and have a simple charm. Any resemblance to living creatures, either on Earth or Mars is purely co-incidental. Animation by Morton Goldsholl.
